definition: violent death/killed in a disaster
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
violent death (idiom); to die in a disaster/an unnatural death

sentences.english: He will not suffer from unnatural death.
Secondly, I will discuss the role and value of Anti-Fatalism in Mozi's ideology.
sentences.chinese: 接著，探讨非命在墨翟思想体系具有的地位与价值。

sentences.english: The Gull of Fortune smiled upon him this once, and no one was killed.
sentences.chinese: 命运之神在朝他微笑，总算没有谁死于非命。

sentences.english: The bad man died in his boots at last.
sentences.chinese: 那个不法之徒最后死于非命。

sentences.english: The theory of Anti-Fatalism is a negative attitude toward fatalism.
sentences.chinese: 非命，是一种对命定论采取的否定态度。

sentences.english: Heat is the top weather related killer in the U.S.
sentences.chinese: 炎热在美国已成为与致人非命有关的头等天气。

sentences.english: Maybe a police officer with the same gun could have prevented a lot of people from dying.
sentences.chinese: 可能使用同类枪支的警察已经阻止了很多人死于非命。

definition: old variant of 亡[wang2]
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased
to be buried with the dead/to die for a cause
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
alas/alack/welladay/wellaway/to die
not benevolent/heartless/numb
life or death/critical (event)
to commit suicide
"universal love", principle advocated by Mozi 墨子[Mo4 zi3], stressing that people should care for everyone equally
to execute all of sb's relatives (as punishment) (old)
executed/to suffer corporal punishment or execution
see 惻隱之心|恻隐之心[ce4 yin3 zhi1 xin1]
to die young
to die
to lose the way/unjust/moral failing
unexpected calamity/sudden disaster
classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
